biography:
The League of Gentlemen were a band active during Marchâ€“December 1980 that featured guitarist Robert Fripp of King Crimson fame. Other members included bass guitarist Sara Lee (who later joined Gang of Four, the B-52's, and Indigo Girls), keyboardist Barry Andrews (formerly of XTC; later of Shriekback) and percussionist Johnny Toobad, replaced late in the band's tenure by Kevin Wilkinson (later of China Crisis and Squeeze).

The 1980 group should not be confused with Robert Fripp's first semi-professional band in the 1960s, which had the same name.

Fripp referred to the 1980 band as "a second-division touring new wave instrumental dance band".
name: The League Of Gentlemen

theaudiodb.biography_en:
The League of Gentlemen were a band active during Marchâ€“December 1980 that featured guitarist Robert Fripp of King Crimson fame. Other members included bass guitarist Sara Lee (who later joined Gang of Four, the B-52's, and Indigo Girls), keyboardist Barry Andrews (formerly of XTC; later of Shriekback) and percussionist Johnny Toobad, replaced late in the band's tenure by Kevin Wilkinson (later of China Crisis and Squeeze).

The 1980 group should not be confused with Robert Fripp's first semi-professional band in the 1960s, which had the same name.

Fripp referred to the 1980 band as "a second-division touring new wave instrumental dance band".
theaudiodb.name: The League of Gentlemen

lastfm.bio_content: There are two artistic groups called the League of Gentlemen. 1. A band active during March-December 1980 that featured guitarist Robert Fripp of King Crimson fame. 2. A quartet of British comedy writer/performers, formed in 1995 by Jeremy Dyson, Mark Gatiss, Steve Pemberton and Reece Shearsmith. They are most famous for their Radio, Stage and TV show titled "The League of Gentlemen". Band Bio: The League Of Gentlemen was a late-1970s band featuring guitarist Robert Fripp of King Crimson. Other members included bass guitarist Sara Lee (who later joined Gang Of Four), keyboardist Barry Andrews (formerly of XTC; later of Shriekback) and drummer Johnny Toobad. Toobad was replaced with a substitute drummer, Kevin Wilkinson, for the bulk of the band's only studio album, released by EG/Polydor in 1981. In 1996, Fripp's independent label Discipline Global Mobile released an "official bootleg" live album of the League Of Gentlemen, Thrang Thrang Gozinbulx. The album features several tracks that were never recorded in the studio by the band. Many of the band's full concerts are available as digital downloads through DGMLive.com or as part of the "Exposures" box set. Read more on Last.fm. User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License; additional terms may apply.

A quartet of British comedy writer/performers, formed in 1995 by Jeremy Dyson, Mark Gatiss, Steve Pemberton and Reece Shearsmith. They are most famous for their Radio, Stage and TV show titled "The League of Gentlemen". Band Bio: The League Of Gentlemen was a late-1970s band featuring guitarist Robert Fripp of King Crimson. Read more on Last.fm

Other members included bass guitarist Sara Lee (who later joined Gang of Four, the B-52's, and Indigo Girls), keyboardist Barry Andrews (formerly of XTC; later of Shriekback) and percussionist Johnny Toobad, replaced late in the band's tenure by Kevin Wilkinson (later of China Crisis and Squeeze).

The 1980 group should not be confused with Robert Fripp's first semi-professional band in the 1960s, which had the same name.
